Data for Np, Am and Cm-245.
Meeting in Reactor Physics, Vancouver, Canada,
Reaction chain analysis with the help of ROOT MERCS
analysis code. MERCS was used for fit of nuclear
parameters on exp. data and to optimize irradiation
conditions -suitable neutron flux and irradiation time.
In mass spectrometry analysis the free parameters were:
Am-241, Am-242m, Cm-242m capture c-s and Am-241
In fission chamber analysis the previously measured
Am-241 capture and branching ratio were used as input
parameters - to obtain Am-242 fission c-s.
with Si- and Ge-detectors (at H9 channel).
The Si and Ge-detector electronic system is able to
record in high counting rates up to 80-kHz for Ge-
detector and up to 20-kHz for Si-detector.
At V4 channel. Microscopic fission chambers  -
in current mode to measure on-line the actinide fission
current with respect to known U-235 fission current.
Each fis. chamber 2 cm long,8 mm in diameter, filled
Type of uncertainty is not explained.
Three irradiation channels could be used.
-The T4 channel provide pure thermal neutrons with
an intensity of the order of 2. x 10**13 n/cm2/s.
-The V4 channel can provide different irradiation
positions with different neutron flux/energy spectra-
the thermal neutron proportion varies from 100% to 85%
and intensities range from 6. x 10**13 n/cm2/s to
-The H9 channel has a neutron flux close to the one
available in an intermediate position of the V4 one.
MCNP code was used to calculate neutron flux
,where F - mean neutron flux measured in
M.Fadil, Ph.D. thesis, INP Grenoble, 2003 (in French).
Fth - thermal component defined with cut 1 eV.
fast characterization of irradiated samples and
and Inductive Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometry)
analysis can be performed after irradiation in V4.

used to normalize the neutron flux:
